name: POLI 182
title: The Power to Punish
description: Interrogates the presuppositions of punishment as legitimate state power. Decentering crime as punishment's conceptual predicate, wider analysis of the penal state's social-scientific, jurisprudential, and philosophical foundations force us to ask: What is punishment? Why punish? How, and whom, to punish?

conditions.restricted_to_majors: politics majors during first and second pass enrollment.

pre_req_data.text: Enrollment is restricted to politics majors during first and second pass enrollment.
